New Records: Adolis Garcia set a new record for most RBI in a single postseason series (15)
Key Match Events: Corey Seager hit a one-out, second-deck homer in the first inning
Adolis Garcia hit a leadoff homer in the first inning for the Rangers
Jose Altuve hit a one-out blast to left-center in the third inning
Adolis Garcia hit a leadoff homer in the third inning for the Rangers
J.P. France had a nightmarish outing in the fourth inning
Josh Jung hit a grounder to first that Abreu dove for and knocked down, preventing a run from scoring
Pre-Game Insights: The series was a topsy-turvy one where no home team won
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Young expressed excitement and happiness for the Rangers' group
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers won their third pennant and their first since winning back-to-back in 2010 and 2011
Others: Adolis Garcia went 4-for-5 with two singles and two homers, powering the Rangers to an 11â€“4 blowout win
Corey Seager went 3-for-5, finishing a triple shy of the cycle
The Rangers used 13 pitchers, five for the Rangers and eight for the Astros
Jordan Montgomery earned the win, pitching 2 1/3 innings, allowing no runs on three hits while striking out one
Javier took the loss after allowing three runs on four hits and a walk
